channel.title: Converting and Dying
channel.description:
I have noticed in throne of lies, a big thing is the Convert mechanics I believe that these gameplay options are gonna be really unique however it will require a lot of balancing in order to make it work.
Firstly Because you have not specified what happens when the mastermind and The Assassin die, so I believe at the moment that when 1 dies a lower rank swaps their role for the dead 1. for example when the Assassin dies a non-killing black rose class changes to become the assassin so the black rose can still kill, or an assassin becomes a mastermind so they will still be able to get some members
however, this can be a problem because if this happens a lot the grave will be filled with nothing but assassins and masterminds making the blue dragon unable to tell what Role's alive and what's dead anymore
my idea was this when a role dies that was changed from its original, not including the masterminds Convert ability so it stills shows their evil role when they die not their blue dragon role. it will instead show what they were when they died for example, an assassin was killed so the newly appointed Servant is now changed to the assassin, however, he dies but when he dies he is shown to be a servant but with something like a symbol next to it so the blue dragon knows that he was a servant but he was changed into an Assassin or an assassin changed into a mastermind
this method could also work with the cult members so when one dies it shows its original class, however it would need to be a different symbol if a cult member was changed into the cult leader, so it still shows his starting class but it tells us that he was a cult leader, not a normal cult member
doing this method would make the blue dragon a lot less confused when these types of roles are shown in the grave so it's not just cults and assassins in the grave.

item.title: Converting and Dying
item.dc:creator: í42-Xblade
item.description:
Calllack:

So about the Mastermind. So long as the Mastermind survives, doesn’t this make Black Rose members want to throw their life away, since the Mastermind can instantly replace them?

Many classes are immune to being converted (they don’t have a converted class) - so let’s say 1 black rose gets himself killed. Well, 3 rounds may go by and he could get no one! It’s quite risky. The risk shouldn’t, in theory, be worth it.

The risk/reward is out there, if they want it, but it would not be wise in most situations.

(Edited for typos and clarification)

Read full topic

item.title: Converting and Dying
item.dc:creator: Calllack
item.description:
So about the Mastermind. So long as the Mastermind survives, doesn’t this make Black Rose members want to throw their life away, since the Mastermind can instantly replace them?
What I mean is: if a new Black Rose member is recruited, they could accuse a Blue Dragon, get them executed and then be executed themselves - which wouldn’t benefit the Blue Dragons a great deal, since the Mastermind will next night replace that member. On the other hand, the Black Rose has just successfully got rid of a target - if the Black Rose picks accusations carefully they could deal with most of the Detective-like roles quickly, right?
(Correct me if I’m wrong, may have missed a key mechanic)

item.title: Converting and Dying
item.dc:creator: Ellie
item.description:
Nobody converts to the Mastermind when he dies. If the Assassin dies and there is another non-MM member, then they’ll be converted to Assassin. If there’s only the MM left, then the next person he recruits ends up becoming the Assassin immediately.
As for keeping the original class name, that wouldn’t be too hard to implement. We’ll talk it over. Thanks for the feedback/ideas.
